data.name: AppPoolCheckCategory
data.value: Issue

data.name: AppPoolCheckDescription
data.value: The IIS site is using the following application pools: {0}.

data.name: AppPoolCheckMoreInformation
data.value: More about application pools

data.name: AppPoolCheckMoreInformationLink
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2154701

data.name: AppPoolCheckRecommendation
data.value: Move the workloads to a single application pool and remove additional application pools.

data.name: AppPoolCheckTitle
data.value: Azure App Service does not support more than one application pool configuration per App Service Application.

data.name: AppPoolIdentityCheckCategory
data.value: Issue

data.name: AppPoolIdentityCheckDescription
data.value: The site's application pool is running as an unsupported user identity type: {0}

data.name: AppPoolIdentityCheckMoreInformation
data.value: More about application pool identity and Azure App Service

data.name: AppPoolIdentityCheckMoreInformationLink
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2154702

data.name: AppPoolIdentityCheckRecommendation
data.value: Set the Application pool to run as ApplicationPoolIdentity.

data.name: AppPoolIdentityCheckTitle
data.value: Azure App Service does not support using the LocalSystem or SpecificUser application pool identity types.

data.name: AuthCheckCategory
data.value: Issue

data.name: AuthCheckDescription
data.value: The following unsupported authentication types were found: {0}

data.name: AuthCheckMoreInformation
data.value: More about App Service auth

data.name: AuthCheckMoreInformationLink
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2154678

data.name: AuthCheckRecommendation
data.value: Disable the unsupported authentication types on the site. After the migration is complete, it will be possible to configure the site using one of the Azure App Service supported authentication types.

data.name: AuthCheckTitle
data.value: Azure App Service supported authentication types and configuration are different from on-premises IIS.

data.name: AuthCheckUnknownCategory
data.value: Issue

data.name: AuthCheckUnknownDescription
data.value: Unable to determine enabled authentication types for all of the site configuration.

data.name: AuthCheckUnknownMoreInformation
data.value: More about configuration errors

data.name: AuthCheckUnknownMoreInformationLink
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2154679

data.name: AuthCheckUnknownRecommendation
data.value: Fix all configuration errors and confirm that all site content locations are accessible to Administrators group.

data.name: AuthCheckUnknownTitle
data.value: Unable to determine authentication types.

data.name: ConfigErrorCheckCategory
data.value: Issue

data.name: ConfigErrorCheckDescription
data.value: The following configuration errors were found: {0}

data.name: ConfigErrorCheckMoreInformation
data.value: More about configuration errors

data.name: ConfigErrorCheckMoreInformationLink
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2154703

data.name: ConfigErrorCheckRecommendation
data.value: Fix all configuration errors, making sure configuration is valid and accessible.

data.name: ConfigErrorCheckTitle
data.value: Migration readiness cannot be determined without reading all applicable configuration.

data.name: ContentSizeCheckCategory
data.value: Issue

data.name: ContentSizeCheckDescription
data.value: The site content appears to be greater than the maximum allowed of 2 GB for successful migration.

data.name: ContentSizeCheckMoreInformation
data.value: More about file content and Azure App Service

data.name: ContentSizeCheckMoreInformationLink
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2154704

data.name: ContentSizeCheckRecommendation
data.value: Evaluate if the site could switch to using non-file system based storage options for static content, such as Azure Storage.

data.name: ContentSizeCheckTitle
data.value: For successful migration site content should be less than 2 GB.

data.name: ContentSizeCheckUnknownCategory
data.value: Issue

data.name: ContentSizeCheckUnknownDescription
data.value: File content size was not able to be determined, which usually indicates an access issue.

data.name: ContentSizeCheckUnknownMoreInformation
data.value: More about content size issues

data.name: ContentSizeCheckUnknownMoreInformationLink
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2154680

data.name: ContentSizeCheckUnknownRecommendation
data.value: Confirm that site is not using UNC shares for content and that all site content locations are accessible to Administrators group.

data.name: ContentSizeCheckUnknownTitle
data.value: Content must be accessible in order to migrate the site.

data.name: FrameworkCheckCategory
data.value: Info

data.name: FrameworkCheckDescription
data.value: The following non-.NET frameworks or unsupported .NET framework versions were detected as possibly in use by this site: {0}

data.name: FrameworkCheckMoreInformation
data.value: More about different frameworks on Azure App Service

data.name: FrameworkCheckMoreInformationLink
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2154686

data.name: FrameworkCheckRecommendation
data.value: App Service supports multiple frameworks, however these have different migration options. Confirm that the non-.NET frameworks are not being used by the site, or consider using an alternate migration option.

data.name: FrameworkCheckTitle
data.value: Migration does not validate the framework for non-.NET sites.

data.name: GlobalModuleCheckCategory
data.value: Issue

data.name: GlobalModuleCheckDescription
data.value: The following unsupported global modules were detected: {0}

data.name: GlobalModuleCheckMoreInformation
data.value: More about IIS GlobalModules and Azure App Service

data.name: GlobalModuleCheckMoreInformationLink
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2154681

data.name: GlobalModuleCheckRecommendation
data.value: Remove the unsupported module(s) from GlobalModules section along with all associated configuration.

data.name: GlobalModuleCheckTitle
data.value: Azure App Service supports limited global modules.

data.name: HttpsBindingCheckCategory
data.value: Info

data.name: HttpsBindingCheckDescription
data.value: The application uses HTTPS.

data.name: HttpsBindingCheckMoreInformation
data.value: Configure SSL for Azure App Service

data.name: HttpsBindingCheckMoreInformationLink
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2154682

data.name: HttpsBindingCheckRecommendation
data.value: Post migration additional steps will be required to associate certificates with the Azure App Service site.

data.name: HttpsBindingCheckTitle
data.value: Additional manual steps are required for HTTPS configuration in App Service.

data.name: IsapiFilterCheckCategory
data.value: Issue

data.name: IsapiFilterCheckDescription
data.value: The following unsupported ISAPI filters were detected: {0}

data.name: IsapiFilterCheckMoreInformation
data.value: More about ISAPI filters and Azure App Service

data.name: IsapiFilterCheckMoreInformationLink
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2154705

data.name: IsapiFilterCheckRecommendation
data.value: Remove the unsupported ISAPI filters.

data.name: IsapiFilterCheckTitle
data.value: Automatic configuration of custom ISAPI filters is not supported.

data.name: IsapiFilterCheckUnknownCategory
data.value: Issue

data.name: IsapiFilterCheckUnknownDescription
data.value: Unable to determine ISAPI filters present for all of the site configuration.

data.name: IsapiFilterCheckUnknownMoreInformation
data.value: More about configuration errors

data.name: IsapiFilterCheckUnknownMoreInformationLink
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2154706

data.name: IsapiFilterCheckUnknownRecommendation
data.value: Fix all configuration errors and confirm that all site content locations are accessible to Administrators group.

data.name: IsapiFilterCheckUnknownTitle
data.value: Automatic configuration of custom ISAPI filters is not supported.

data.name: LocationTagCheckCategory
data.value: Issue

data.name: LocationTagCheckDescription
data.value: The following location paths were found in the applicationHost.config file: {0}

data.name: LocationTagCheckMoreInformation
data.value: More about location tags

data.name: LocationTagCheckMoreInformationLink
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2154707

data.name: LocationTagCheckRecommendation
data.value: Move the location path configuration to either the site's root web.config file, or to a web.config file associated with the specific application to which they apply.

data.name: LocationTagCheckTitle
data.value: Migration method does not support moving location path configuration in applicationHost.config.

data.name: ProtocolCheckCategory
data.value: Issue

data.name: ProtocolCheckDescription
data.value: Bindings were found using the following unsupported protocols: {0}

data.name: ProtocolCheckMoreInformation
data.value: Supported protocol information

data.name: ProtocolCheckMoreInformationLink
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2154683

data.name: ProtocolCheckRecommendation
data.value: Remove the bindings with protocols that are not HTTP or HTTPS.

data.name: ProtocolCheckTitle
data.value: Azure App Service only supports HTTP and HTTPS protocol.

data.name: TcpPortCheckCategory
data.value: Info

data.name: TcpPortCheckDescription
data.value: Bindings were found on the following unsupported ports: {0}

data.name: TcpPortCheckMoreInformation
data.value: More about ports on Azure App Service

data.name: TcpPortCheckMoreInformationLink
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2154684

data.name: TcpPortCheckRecommendation
data.value: Azure App Services supports only ports 80 and 443. Clients making requests to the site should update the port in their requests to use 80 or 443.

data.name: TcpPortCheckTitle
data.value: Azure App Service does not support incoming traffic on ports other than 80 and 443.

data.name: VirtualDirectoryCheckCategory
data.value: Issue

data.name: VirtualDirectoryCheckDescription
data.value: The following virtual directories are hosted on UNC shares: {0}

data.name: VirtualDirectoryCheckMoreInformation
data.value: More about UNC share limitations

data.name: VirtualDirectoryCheckMoreInformationLink
data.value: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2154685

data.name: VirtualDirectoryCheckRecommendation
data.value: Move content to a local file path or consider changing to a non-file system based storage option, such as Azure Storage. If using shared configuration, disable shared configuration for the server before modifying content paths.

data.name: VirtualDirectoryCheckTitle
data.value: Migration does not support migrating site content hosted on UNC shares.
